com.ibm.gaiandb.apps

Class DBConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.gaiandb.apps.DBConnector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SensorDemo, SensorMonitor

    public class DBConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a framework for applications to connect to GaianDB easily.
    Author:
    Samir Talwar - stalwar@uk.ibm.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBConnector()
      Creates a new connector, but does not connect to any database until the connect method is called.
      DBConnector(java.lang.String[] args)
      Initialises the connection URL, username and password from the args parameter - usually command-line arguments.

      • DBConnector

        public DBConnector()
        Creates a new connector, but does not connect to any database until the connect method is called.

      • DBConnector

        public DBConnector(java.lang.String[] args)
        Initialises the connection URL, username and password from the args parameter - usually command-line arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - The application's command-line arguments.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the Derby client driver class cannot be found.
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException

      • getRetryDelay

        public int getRetryDelay()
        Retrieves the time we delay by between connections retries.
        Returns:
        The delay time, in seconds.

      • setRetryDelay

        public void setRetryDelay(int retryDelay)
        Sets the delay time between connection retries.
        Parameters:
        retryDelay - The new delay time, in seconds.

      • connect

        public java.sql.Connection connect(java.lang.String url)
                            throws javax.security.auth.login.LoginException,
                                   java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • connect

        public java.sql.Connection connect(java.lang.String url,
                                   java.util.Properties info)
                            throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                   javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Connects to the database at the URL provided, using the provided username and password. Will try again if it fails.
        Parameters:
        url - The JDBC URL of the database in the form jdbc:subprotocol:subname.
        user - The chosen username.
        password - The password associated with the given username.
        Returns:
        The database connection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the Derby client driver class cannot be found.
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException

      • connect

        public java.sql.Connection connect(java.lang.String url,
                                   java.util.Properties info,
                                   boolean retry)
                            throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                   javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Connects to the database at the URL provided, using the provided properties.
        Parameters:
        url - The JDBC URL of the database in the form jdbc:subprotocol:subname.
        user - The chosen username.
        password - The password associated with the given username.
        retry - If true, this method will keep trying to connect indefinitely until it succeeds. If false, it will return null on failure.
        Returns:
        The database connection on success, or null on failure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the Derby client driver class cannot be found.
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException

      • connect

        public java.sql.Connection connect()
                            throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                   javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Connects using the pre-defined properties.
        Returns:
        The database connection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the Derby client driver class cannot be found.
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Returns the connection for use with other classes.
        Returns:
        A connection to the database, or null if one has not been established yet.

      • terminate

        public static void terminate(java.lang.String message)
        Displays the message you've given and a termination message, then quits the program. Useful for a quick bailout.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to display on System.err.
